Text: At last, it is time for the main event.

The venue bursts into glorious light, and ancient
script appears on the floor of the stadium.

The letters glow white as they expand into a dome
which only further electrifies the cheers of the
crowd.

The challengers step into the dome, and then a
suitable opponent is chosen by the Sanctuary.
Once the fight is underway, there is no outside
intervention until one side is unable to continue.
I watch the proceedings idly from the stands.

(Having to go at it until one side's completely laid
out would make me hesitate to use even my best
act. The risk of my true strength getting exposed
is pretty high.)
Up first, hailing from the Oriana Kingdom, is...
Dubelay Batterieze!

(Just like that, the first challenger is introduced
and steps into the dome. Apparently he's some tough
guy from the Knight Order.)
Did ya hear? They say someone died last year.
Seriously?!

Why the hell would anyone pay 10,000 zeni to take
that kinda risk...

Well, if ya beat the ancient warrior, ya get a
commemorative medal.

And with one of those babies, ya can pretty much take
yer pick of a job at any order, anywhere!
*whistles* That is pretty sweet!
(Interesting. Thanks for the classic NPC dialogue.)

(Seems that beating this Goddess' Trial comes with
a lotta clout.)
(...But enough about that.)

(I wonder if there isn't something shadowbrokery to
be done at this event...)
Ancient warriors!
Heed my call!!!
The bell tolls.
But it looks like the ancient warrior was a no-show.

Next! From the Midgar Kingdom's Knight Order, Bunny
Bette!!!

(Sittin' back and being an extra in an event this
huge just seems so...)
(Like, I gotta make a flashy entrance,)
(show off my moves...)
(and make everybody wonder who the hell I am!)
(Or somethin’ like that...)
The bell tolls again.

Next! From the Laugus Vigilance Committee...Noam
Ore!!!
(If only they took surprise entrants...)
(I mean, I could just force my way onto the field.)

(But I also feel like I should save something spicy
like that for a more important scene.)
(Also, are these fights only one-on-one...?)

(But the most shadowbroker play of all would be to
climb the bracket tourney style while passing myself
off as a weak nobody...)
(Something like that'd be really cool...)

As I run through the various options in my head, the
event marches on.

It's not like I can help it. If I couldn't come up
with anything despite brainstorming in the
days leading up to the trial, I'm certainly
not going to wing it at the last minute.

So I just give up halfway and enjoy the show
as an extra.

We don't have many events on this scale back in the
other world, so I find it unexpectedly fun. I even
get to make a little cash betting on the matches.
(...Now that I think about it, I haven't seen Alpha.)
//カットシーン再生

I watch the stream of challengers take the stage,
wondering when Alpha will show up.

An ancient warrior finally appears for the fourteenth
entrant.

When Annerose, a traveler from Velgalta, the Land of
Blades, enters the dome, the ancient script begins to
glow in response.

The light forms a humanoid shape from which emerges
a translucent warrior. Based on the commentary, he is
apparently known as Borg.

(The two fight a yawn-inducing battle and Annerose
wins a dry victory. I'd been looking forward to seeing
an ancient warrior in action, but in the end he was a
bit of a letdown.)
(Hopefully some tougher guys get summoned later on.)
I continue watching the proceedings.

(Looks like the problem is that Annerose was just
really strong.)

A total of eight warriors have been summoned so far,
but Annerose was the only contestant to win.

(In that light, maybe Mr. Borg was actually a pretty
rough customer.)

As the night wears on, the number of challengers
dwindle.
*yawn*
(Guess we're gettin' close the end...)

(Looks more and more like that Annerose is gonna be
the only one to successfully take out her opponent.)

Just as the trials looked to be winding down, a
certain name is called.

Next! From the Midgar Academy for Dark Knights...
Cid Kagenou!!!
(Next up, Cid Kagenou, huh?)
(That's a side character name if I ever heard one.)
(Cid Kagenou...)
Huh???
